item.title: Reverse Mortgages: How to Choose Between a Lump Sum, Line of Credit or Monthly Payment
item.description: The best option depends on how you anticipate using the reverse mortgage proceeds.

item.title: Late Car Payments Are Piling Up at Record Levels as More Drivers Face Delinquency
item.description: U.S. subprime auto delinquencies reached 6.65% in October, according to Fitch Ratings, which has tracked the data since the early '90s.

item.title: For Most Americans, Financial Success Now Means Being Debt-Free
item.description: The new hallmark of financial success? Cutting bad debt and reclaiming control.

item.title: Will You Need Long-Term Care? Here’s What the Statistics Say
item.description: Gender, race and education level all play a role in whether you'll need long-term care.

item.title: Using a ‘Blended Income’ Strategy Can Help Boost Your Retirement Cash Flow
item.description: The idea is to balance fixed and variable income streams.
